title: Digital Process Developer
job_function: Project Management, Business Development, and Strategy/Planning
description:
**Are you driven by curiosity and eager to make a real difference through innovation?**
 We are looking for a Digital Process Developer that wants to shape the future of how we work! If you're a creative problem-solver with strong communication skills, apply today and join a team that goes the extra mile together.
   

  

 At If, we’re dedicated to crafting positive customer experiences through collaboration and innovative thinking. Insurance is about life, and when the unexpected happens, we’re always there to support our customers.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Digital Process Developer, you will play a key role in translating business and customer needs into clear actions. You will analyze business processes, define technical requirements, and collaborate closely with development teams to ensure solutions are effectively implemented. Your work will involve bridging the gap between business needs and technical execution, ensuring that all stakeholders are aligned on both sides.
   

  

 What sets this role apart is the blend of human and technical aspects—you will thrive by using your technical knowledge, analytical mindset and by bringing your curiosity and self-leadership to the table. We’re looking for someone who can explain complex ideas simply, enjoys working in a dynamic environment, and knows how to inspire others through great communication.
   

  

**We offer**
 In the same way that we place high demands on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer. With us, you get the opportunity to become part of a team where everyone walks that extra mile – both for our customers and our colleagues. We welcome you to an informal working environment with lots of smiles and a positive attitude.
   

  

**Additional benefits of working at If:**
* An including work environment where everyone is welcome
* Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
* Social activities, as well as highly skilled professional environment
* Possibility of hybrid workplace
* Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities
* Great insurance benefits
* Lunch benefit
* High pension savings


**About The Team**
 As part of our team, you'll play a key role in shaping digital experiences for all Nordic markets and customer segments. With an agile approach, we focus on delivering value quickly and efficiently. You’ll collaborate closely with your squad while exchanging knowledge and insights with colleagues across the Nordics.
   

  

**Who are you…?**
* An initiative-taker, always looking for ways to improve processes and outcomes.
* A problem solver, tackling complex issues head-on with a can-do attitude.
* A collaborator, natural at facilitating, challenging, and analyzing with colleagues.
* A team player, building strong relationships and fostering collaboration across departments. Proactive and energetic, contributing to a positive team and company culture.
* An excellent communicator, bridging the gap between IT and operations, making complex information accessible.
* A self-leader, taking ownership, managing time effectively, and setting clear goals. Possessing a growth mindset, thriving in dynamic environments and open to new ideas.
* A tech enthusiast, enjoying working with stakeholders and development, with a keen interest in technology. Knowledge and/or experience in agile methodologies and a structured approach.


**You also have**
* Minimum bachelor's degree in computer science/other related field is preferred. However, a strong background in relevant work experience can replace formal education
* A strong technical background and experience in a similar role
* Experience in creating, preparing and working with test management and test planning
* Experience in business and process requirement analysis
* Strong communication, collaboration, and stakeholder management skills
* Strong analytical skills
* Proactive attitude with a passion for solving complex problems.
* Fluency in English, both written and verbal


**Additional Facts And The Recruitment Process**
**Application deadline:** 
 Screening and interviewing will start immediately. However, the application deadline is 3th of November 2024.
   

**To apply for the position:** 
 Please attach your CV. After submitting your application, you will receive a set of tests designed to assess your skills and suitability for the role. These tests are an integral part of our recruitment process and help us ensure a fair and thorough evaluation of all candidates. Based on the test results candidates will be invited to interviews.
   

**Work location:** 
 Gothenburg or Stockholm, Sweden.
   

**Travelling:** 
 Some travel within the Nordics will be required.
   

**Start** 
 : As soon as possible/by agreement.
   

  

 For more information, please contact
   

  

 Hanna Lindahl, Chapter Lead, Service Development, Digital Claims +46 761 39 75 18.
   

  

 Martin Pettersson, Chapter Lead, Service Development, Digital Claims, +46 706 74 72 77.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!
   

  

**About Us**
  

***We are If. Our purpose is to give people confidence today to shape their tomorrow.**
 To make this possible, trust is our backbone. We stay ahead and challenge ourselves to grow. And we always put our hearts into it – because it takes more than bright minds to make brilliant things happen.
   

  

 We are the leading insurance company in the Nordics/Baltics and a stable employer with 7,900 dedicated professionals. But most importantly, we are protectors of people, enablers of companies and encouragers of dreams. With our joint force of expertise and engagement we always stand by our customers’ side. Giving them the security and the confidence to be curious, explore new worlds, start new businesses and live their lives.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer, convinced that a diverse and inclusive work culture boosts innovation and the growth of intellectual capital in many ways. It doesn’t matter who you are, where you come from, or what you look like. It is the different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences each of us have and share, that will make a difference.
   

  

 Come and join us!*

title: Senior full stack developer with IAM knowledge
description:
**Job ID: 26282** 


  
 





 We are looking for a senior developer to join our Access Management team within the Identity and Access Management (IAM) organisation. This is an opportunity for you to be part of an international team, eager to support our mission to Protect the Bank: De-risked, Compliant, Secure & Protected.  
 








**About this opportunity** 







  

  



 In IAM, we provide centralised IAM solutions and standardised IAM services with the ambition to strengthen the security of the bank and act as single point of contact for all units within Nordea, utilizing our solutions and services. IAM belongs to the Cyber Security area within Nordea. 
 





  

  



 As a senior developer, you will play a key role in maturing our end to end solution that authenticates our users, including multifactor authentication, password self-service and password less functionality. You will be responsible both for the user experience, and for the back end integrations towards other bank systems. You will be expected to develop new features and to contribute to overall stability and maturity of our solution.
 





  

  



**What you’ll be doing:** 





* Maturing our authentication services by designing and developing new features in alignment with IAM compliance requirements and security guidelines to support changing business needs
* Work with continuous improvement of already existing code and bug fixes
* Take part in quality assurance, security testing, maintenance activities
* Act as an technical expert and role model following software good practices and guidelines
* Work closely with your colleges and share knowledge with others





 The role is based in modern premises located centrally in Helsinki, Stockholm, Oslo, or in the TriCity area in Poland, with the possibility to work partly from home.
 





  
 





 Please, note the candidate should be located in the country of hire already.
 








**Who you are**





 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  
 





  
 





**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:** 





* Are a senior/expert full stack developer with operations skills, with focus on end2end solutions


* Have excellent troubleshooting skills
* A proactive, constructive and can-do oriented mind-set and a strong driving force
* A structured and organised way of working with the ability to deliver results with high quality
* Strong technical competence and documentation skills
* Can contribute to continuous improvement in terms of efficiency, reducing risk and applying automation
* Can work close with others to plan, design, develop, test and maintain our end to end solution
* Fluent in English (spoken and written)



  

  



**Your experience and background:** 





* Experience with development of REST API's using Java Spring Boot microservices
* Experience with Angular/NodeJS/JavaScript/HTML/CSS skills for the frontend part
* Experience with integrating strong authentication methods in an UI
* Experience with PowerShell and WebView
* Experience with developer tools such as: IntelliJ/Eclipse, VSCode, Git
* Kubernetes experience
* Skills for parameter use and integration of National ID's like MitID, BankID, FTN
* Linux and LDAP
* Several years of proven experience working with authentication solutions such as:  Multifactor authentication,  Microsoft Windows Hello for Business, hardware tokens
* You have knowledge about Microsoft Entra, authentication methods and protocols, SSO, OIDC, SAML, Kerberos etc.
* Previous experience working in a DevOps team in Agile/Scrum setup



  

  



 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 



 23/10/2024
 



 . For more information, you’re welcome to contact Chatrine Höök at chatrine.hook@nordea.com.
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  

  



 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.
 





  
 





**For a candidates in Sweden:** 
 For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.
 **For a candidates in Poland:** 




 Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following:
 





  
 





 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp.
 





  
 





 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf.
 





  
 





 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: Cloud Solutions Developer
company_industry: Software Development, Broadcast Media Production and Distribution, and Technology, Information and Media
description:
**About Vizrt** 




 Vizrt is a global leader in software-defined visual storytelling tools for media content creators. Our innovative solutions empower broadcasters, journalists, and content creators to engage audiences with captivating and immersive visual experiences. We continuously push the boundaries of technology to deliver cutting-edge solutions that transform the way content is produced, managed, and delivered.
 



 We are looking for a skilled
 **Azure Integration Developer/Cloud Solutions Developer** 
 to design, develop, and maintain scalable integration solutions using Azure services, including Azure Logic Apps, Azure Functions, and Python-based scripting. In this role, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to create efficient, robust, and scalable data pipelines, APIs, and business processes within the Azure cloud ecosystem.
 



 If you thrive in a collaborative and innovative environment and are passionate about cloud technologies and data-driven projects, this is the role for you!
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* **Azure Logic Apps Development:** 
 Design, develop, and maintain Azure Logic Apps to automate business processes and data workflows by integrating various services (APIs, databases, storage
* **Azure Functions Development:** 
 Build and deploy Azure Functions for event-driven tasks, real-time data processing, and system integrations with other Azure services (e.g., Cosmos DB, Blob Storage
* **Python Coding & Automation:** 
 Develop Python scripts to automate processes, handle data transformation, and support custom business logic, with reusable modules interacting with Azure services and APIs
* **Data Integration:** 
 Design and implement data pipelines for moving, transforming, and storing data across systems using Azure Data Factory (ADF) or Logic Apps, ensuring seamless integration of data from on-premises, SaaS, and cloud applications
* **Collaboration & Documentation:** 
 Collaborate with DevOps, data engineers, and other teams for smooth deployment and operation of solutions. Create documentation, including technical specifications and architectural diagrams, for the developed solutions



  





**Requirements:** 




 You are an experienced Azure developer with a passion for designing scalable solutions. You can manage multiple tasks independently while excelling in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
 



  





**Qualifications:** 



* Proficiency in developing Azure Logic Apps and Azure Functions
* Strong experience with Python scripting for automation and data processing
* Understanding of REST APIs, webhooks, and third-party API integration
* Experience with data integration tools like Azure Data Factory (ADF) or Synapse Pipelines
* Proven experience in data integration projects within the Azure cloud ecosystem



  





**Meriting Skills:** 



* Experience with serverless architectures and event-driven systems
* Knowledge of DevOps and CI/CD pipelines for Azure resource deployment
* Familiarity with version control (Git) and project management tools (Jira, Azure DevOps)



  





**Education & Experience:** 



* Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Technology, or equivalent work experience
* 3+ years of experience with Azure cloud services, including Azure Logic Apps, Azure Functions, and Python development



  





**Personal Attributes:** 



* Excellent communication skills, enabling effective collaboration with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Strong problem-solving ability, with a focus on delivering solutions that meet business and technical requirements
* A proactive team player who enjoys working with colleagues across different disciplines



  





**Benefits:** 




 We offer an exciting position in an open and friendly environment where we help each other to develop and create value. Your work will have a true impact on Vizrt's future Success.
 


* Work-Life balance as it plays an important role in generating long-lasting productivity and output
* A workplace that believes strength is found in diversity
* Rewards - you will enjoy flexible working hours, competitive remuneration, an attractive pension package, health care insurance, wellness allowance, and other benefits
* The Stockholm office has approximately 70 employees of more than 20 different nationalities represented at the office. We are in a brand-new office in Lilla Bantorget, 6 min walk from the central station in Stockholm
* The stories we tell are unique. We'd love to hear yours



  





**Recruitment Process:** 



* Recruiter Screening
* Team Interview
* Technical Discussion
* Final Interview

title: Director of Engineering
description:
**Xensam: SAM Disrupters** 




 Xensam is the leading provider of AI-powered, cloud-hosted Software Asset Management technology. We’re looking for key players to join us as we scale our impact and build the Xensam team together. We take our culture seriously and strive to maintain the excellence, energy & enthusiasm that flows through the organization today.
 



  





 We look for candidates who are passionate about what they do and ready to work the Xensam way. We know that experience counts, but we also know that it’s you, the person behind the experience, that makes it count.
 



  





**About the role** 




 We are seeking you, who are an experienced Director of Engineering, to lead and have direct staff responsibility of our diverse R&D teams, including DBAs, ensuring that all projects align with business values and are completed on time. The ideal candidate will focus on enhancing productivity, quality, recruiting new team members and coaching across various departments.
 



  





**This role requires technical knowledge and experience but will mainly be about managing people, and not the product.** 




  





**Your responsibilities** 



* **Department Management:** 
 Oversee and coordinate the activities of various R&D departments, including software development, quality assurance, security engineering, DevOps/infrastructure, and database teams.
* **Staff Development:** 
 Conduct one-on-one meetings, provide coaching, take part in recruitment, and manage staff development to foster a high-performing team environment. Build and scale teams, both on-site and remote. This would include some traveling to other countries.
* **Performance Monitoring:** 
 Implement metrics to monitor team performance, quality and productivity, identifying areas for improvement and help develop processes and best practice.
* **Stakeholder Communication:** 
 Maintain open communication with stakeholders to ensure project alignment with business values.



  





**Some of the other responsibilities that this role will include** 



* **Collaboration with Product Managers:** 
 Oversee product managers running individual teams to ensure cohesive project execution and alignment with company goals.
* **Productivity and Deadlines:** 
 Ensure teams meet productivity goals and project deadlines while aligning with business objectives.



  





**Who are you?** 



* You have proven experience as an Engineering Manager, Director of Engineering, or a similar leadership role, with direct responsibility for cross-functional R&D teams.
* You demonstrate strong leadership skills, with a focus on team development, coaching, quality, and productivity.
* You possess excellent communication and organizational abilities, with a direct approach and experience in making tough decisions.
* You are skilled in managing multiple departments and projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
* You hold a bachelor's degree in Engineering or a related field, or have equivalent technical experience, such as prior work as a software developer.
* **You are fluent in both verbal and written English and Swedish.**



  





**What you get** 



* A dynamic role that focuses on "freedom under responsibility"
* 3 days in-office schedule (remote Mondays & Fridays)
* A generous work culture with free access to beverages & snacks, gym, bi-weekly massages at the office, shuffleboard, and other games etc.
* If sales targets are met, an annual destination trip awaits all employees
* Work with a diverse group driven by ambition as well as having fun together with different activities
* Great opportunity to influence your career development as well as the company's
* Work with the latest technology in the fastest-growing SAM software in the market



  





**At Xensam, our core values define our workplace atmosphere** 




**REBELLIOUS** 
 We foster a rebellious spirit, promoting freedom within responsibilities and encouraging initiative.
 



**HUMANE** 
 Our team promotes a caring, inclusive environment where diversity is valued, and individuals are respected and empowered to be themselves.
 



**HARMONIOUS** 
 We prioritize harmony, valuing work-life balance, and creating a pleasant atmosphere.
 



  





 Join Xensam for a balanced, collaborative, and caring workplace. If you're a team player eager to grow professionally,
 **APPLY now!**

title: Senior Software Engineer, Server Reliability (Europe) - World of Warcraft
description:
**Team Name**
 World of Warcraft
   

  

**Job Title**
 Senior Software Engineer, Server Reliability (Europe) - World of Warcraft
   

  

**Requisition ID**
 R023533
   

  

**Job Description**
 The World of Warcraft team is seeking an engineer to join the Server Reliability team in Europe. In this role, you will work with engineers and designers to enable hosting new and exciting content.
   

  

 As a Server Reliability Engineer, we’ll need you to investigate any service issues that occur, partnering closely with designers and engineers to push new content and deploy fixes. You’ll find yourself digging into source code, reviewing changes looking for hidden complexities, tracking evidence in logs and server telemetry, and using your eye for reliability to help the team make great decisions. If you are someone who loves solving technical service issues, we’d love to see your application.
   

  

 This role will be fully remote in Europe, preferably Sweden or Ireland where the existing team can be found.
   

  

**What You Will Do…**
* Create, and support the build systems and automation for World of Warcraft.
* Deploy data hotfixes to databases throughout the development lifecycle.
* Review, build, and deploy server software in a live environment.
* Diagnose software problems occurring within the World of Warcraft servers.
* Promote, contribute to, and participate in our culture of inclusion and diversity


**Minimum Requirements**
* The ability to use deductive reasoning to solve problems
* 5+ Years of Software Development Experience
* Proficiency with C++
* A tenacious curiosity for diagnosing exactly why something went wrong
* A reliability geared mindset, to be able to look at the architecture of a system and help predict how changes might impact customers and infrastructure
* Familiarity with Networking and Server Design concepts
* Fluency in an object-oriented programming language
* Strong communication skills


 We’re also interested in hearing stories you may have about…
   

  

* Working with Linux and/or Databases
* Used automation to help reduce toil and/or increase development velocity.
* Needing to solve problems that were tricky and technical


**Your Platform**
 Best known for iconic video game universes including Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, and StarCraft®, Blizzard Entertainment, Inc. (www.blizzard.com), a division of Activision Blizzard, which was acquired by Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), is a premier developer and publisher of entertainment experiences. Blizzard Entertainment has created some of the industry’s most critically acclaimed and genre-defining games over the last 30 years, with a track record that includes multiple Game of the Year awards. Blizzard Entertainment engages tens of millions of players around the world with titles available on PC via Battle.net®, Xbox, PlayStation, Nintendo Switch, iOS, and Android.
   

  

**Our World**
 Activision Blizzard, Inc., is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including
 *Call of Duty* 
 ®,
 *World of Warcraft®* 
 ,
 *Overwatch* 
 ®,
 *Diablo* 
 ®,
 *Candy Crush* 
 ™ and
 *Bubble Witch* 
 ™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet!
   

  

 Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered!
   

  

*The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.*
 We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply.
   

  

 We are committed to working with and providing reasonable assistance to individuals with physical and mental disabilities. If you are a disabled individual requiring an accommodation to apply for an open position, please email your request to accommodationrequests@activisionblizzard.com. General employment questions cannot be accepted or processed here. Thank you for your interest.
   

  

 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, among other characteristics.

title: Lead Software Engineer Back End (Bangkok based – Relocation provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team**
 In Agoda’s Back-End Engineering department, we build scalable, fault-tolerant systems and APIs that host our core business logic. Our systems cover all major areas of our business: inventory and pricing, product information, customer data, communications, partner data, booking systems, payments, and more. We employ state-of-the-art CI/CD and testing techniques to ensure everything works without downtime. Our systems are self-healing, responding gracefully to extreme loads or unexpected input. We use modern languages like Kotlin and Scala, Data technologies Kafka, Spark, MLflow, Kubeflow, VastStorage, StarRocks and agile development practices. Most importantly, we hire great people from around the world and empower them to be successful.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 Agoda Platform team is looking for developers to work on mission-critical systems that serve millions of users daily. You will have the chance to work on innovative projects, using cutting-edge technologies, and make a significant impact on our business and the travel industry.
   

  

**What You’ll Need To Succeed**
* 10+ years of experience developing performance-critical applications in a production environment using Scala, Java, Kotlin, C#, Go or relevant modern programming languages.
* Strong RDBMS knowledge (SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL, or other).
* Ability to direct significant company-wide projects and sets technical vision.
* Good command of the English language.
* Deeply involved in making architectural decisions, setting the standard and direction for the team.
* Implement advanced CI/CD pipelines and robust testing strategies to ensure seamless integration, deployment, and high code quality.
* Passion for software development and continuous improvement of your knowledge and skills.


**It’s Great if You Have**
* Knowledge in NoSQL, Queueing systems (Kafka, RabbitMQ, ActiveMQ, MSMQ), and Play framework.


 #newdelhi #Pune #Hyderabad #Bangalore #Mumbai #Bengaluru #Chennai #Kolkata #Lucknow #sanfrancisco #sanjose #losangeles #sandiego #oakland #denver #miami #orlando #atlanta #chicago #boston #detroit #newyork #portland #philadelphia #dallas #houston #austin #seattle #sydney #melbourne #perth #toronto #vancouver #montreal #shanghai #beijing #shenzhen #prague #Brno #Ostrava #cairo #alexandria #giza #estonia #paris #berlin #munich #hamburg #stuttgart #cologne #frankfurt #hongkong #budapest #jakarta #bali #dublin #telaviv #milan #rome #tokyo #osaka #kualalumpur #amsterdam #oslo #manila #warsaw #krakow #bucharest #moscow #saintpetersburg #capetown #johannesburg #seoul #barcelona #madrid #stockholm #zurich #taipei #bangkok #Phuket #istanbul #london #manchester #edinburgh #kiev #hcmc #hanoi #wroclaw #poznan #katowice #rio #salvador #IT #4 #5
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .
   

  

 To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: People Analytics Manager
description:
**Job Description**
 Together with our amazing People Analytics teammates from DoorDash, we’re looking for an Analytics Manager to lead our small but mighty team of analysts responsible for self-service reporting and deep dives across the People space. The ideal candidate will excel as a “player - coach”, excited to provide functional leadership to the team, provide thought partnership to their stakeholders, and roll up their sleeves to dive into the data themselves.
   

  

 The role can be based in Finland (preferred), or Sweden. You can work onsite, hybrid, or fully remote from one of the mentioned locations - the work format is up to you 🙌
   

  

 You will work directly with stakeholders across the Wolt people team (as well as the rest of the Wolt business), serving as their thought partner to solve problems and prioritize solutions to big, thorny questions. You will report directly to the US-based Sr. Manager of People Analytics at DoorDash, and will partner closely with them and your US-based peers in Recruiting Analytics and Data Science to lead People Analytics across the globe.
   

  

**Your daily work will include**
* Supervising the day-to-day work of your team of analysts responsible for people analytics, recruiting analytics, and similar.
* Serving as the trusted advisor, thought leader, and representative of the global People Analytics team to your stakeholders across Wolt.
* Leading the development of metrics, reports, dashboards and analyses, putting high-quality insights directly into the hands of your stakeholders.
* Developing a cohesive vision and roadmap together with your peers and partner teams across the globe, including US-based Data Science, People Analytics, Recruiting Analytics, Data Engineering, and People Applications teams.
* Dive into the data, diagnosing data and reporting needs, building new solutions, and providing answers to big, ambiguous, critical problems.


**Our humble expectations**
* Education: Degree in a quantitatively focused discipline, e.g., experimental psychology, economics, computer science, physics, or similar.
* Strong experience working as an Analyst, BI Developer, Analytics Engineer, Data Scientist, or techy Data Analyst. People/HR Analytics experience is strongly preferred.
* Experience leading small teams with outsized impact.
* Demonstrated experience working with and influencing technical and nontechnical cross-functional peers and stakeholders. This will be a highly visible role within the People Team, and building trust with your colleagues will be critical.
* Tech skills: Python, SQL, R, AWS, and one of the modern BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, Looker, Sigma, or similar). Advanced SQL skills, and ability to write optimized queries for large data sets.
* Subject Matter Expertise: Deep expertise in data visualization and analysis. Some expertise in statistics is preferred (regressions, t-tests). Nice to have: Experience analyzing survey data.
* Since you’ll be taking care of our internal stakeholders, we’re looking for someone who truly enjoys interacting with people on a daily basis. The ability to search for information and ask relevant questions from various teams will be crucial.


**Next Steps**
**Why you'll love working with us
   

  

 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!**
* Complex environment with tons of data just waiting to be utilized — you’ll get hands-on experience in working on various TA metrics and topics.
* You can choose the ways of working - work onsite, hybrid, or fully remote from one of the locations mentioned above.
* You would get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, think big but stay humble, do right by people, treat others kindly and justly, and recognize that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement. Read more about how we work.


 If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely ambitious team, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!
   

  

 If you have any further questions about the position, you can turn to:
   

  

 Orsi Kocsis, Senior Talent Acquisition Partner - orsolya.kocsis@wolt.com
   

  

 Please note that
 **we do not accept applications sent by mail** 
 . You should submit your application through our careers website!
   

  

**About Wolt**
*Wolt is a Helsinki-based technology company that provides an online platform for consumers, merchants, and couriers. It connects people looking to order food and other goods with people interested in selling and delivering them. To enable this, Wolt develops a wide range of technologies from local logistics to retail software and financial solutions – as well as operating its own grocery stores under the Wolt Market brand. Wolt’s products include Wolt+ (subscription service for customers), Wolt for Work (meal benefits and office deliveries for companies), Wolt Drive (fast last-mile deliveries for merchants), and Wolt Self-Delivery (service for merchant partners with their own delivery staff). Wolt’s mission is to make cities better by empowering and growing local communities. Wolt was founded in 2014 and joined forces with DoorDash in 2022. DoorDash operates in 31 countries today, 27 of which are with the Wolt product and brand.*
***So, why work at Wolt?***
**At Wolt, We’re About Getting Things Done.**
 You’ll probably enjoy it here if you like taking ownership, developing yourself, and being around friendly, humble, and ambitious people.
   

  

*We work hard to make cities into better places, and it’s pretty cool seeing us grow every week. If you’re passionate about building things that just… work, Wolt might be for you.*
***Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion**
 We want to have all sorts of people in our team – people like you and me, and people different from you and me. To be able to work with diverse teammates – when it comes to gender, age, ethnicity, life background, sexual orientation, political views, religion, or any other personal trait – we consciously aim to offer equal opportunity for everyone to work with us. This is because we believe diverse teams make the most thought-through decisions and build things in the most inclusive way.*
*Join us today to build Wolt together.*

title: Lead Developer D365 till Biometria
description:
Har du erfarenhet av att arbeta med utveckling och integration i Microsoft Dynamics 365 F&O? Vi söker nu dig som tillsammans med Biometria vill vara med och utveckla ett helt nytt IT-system som kommer förändra, effektivisera och modernisera hela skogsbranschen! Sök tjänsten redan idag, vi arbetar med löpande urval.
 



  

**Företag :**
 Biometria ek. för.
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, 100%
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

  

 Biometria är en central aktör inom svensk skogsnäring och de befinner sig just nu i en spännande utvecklingsfas. Som Lead Developer inom området Redovisning & Transport kommer du ha du en central roll i utvecklingen av deras helt nya IT-system.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds:**



  

  
* En nyckelroll i utvecklingsfasen av ett nytt IT-system som kommer revulotionera svensk skogsindustri
  
* Att vara en del av ett framåtsträvande företag där du får arbeta med den allra senaste tekniken
  
* En flexibel arbetsplats med möjlighet att arbeta på distans
  


  


  

**Vill du veta mer om hur det är att arbeta på Biometria?**
  

 Läs intervjuer med några av deras medarbetare här .
 


  


  

**Arbetsuppgifter:**
  

 I rollen som Lead Developer har du en avgörande roll där du tillsammans med utvecklingsteamet hanterar Microsoft Dynamics 365 (Finance and Operations) i den molnbaserade plattformen. Förutom att arbeta med utveckling och integration kommer du också ansvara för att leda, coacha och utveckla dina teammedlemmar.
   




**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har ett par års erfarenhet av Microsoft Dynamics 365 (Finance and Operations), både när det kommer till utveckling och integration
  
* Har goda kunskaper i programmeringsspråket X++
  
* Har erfarenhet av verktyget Azure Devops
  
* Har ett genuint intresse för ledarskap
  
* Är obehindrad i svenska i både tal och skrift då det krävs för kommunikation med kollegor samt dokumentation
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har:**



  

  
* Tidigare erfarenhet av att leda och coacha andra
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Målmedveten
  
* Ansvarstagande
  
* Hjälpsam
  
* Intellektuellt nyfiken
  


  


  

**Övrigt:**
 Finns möjlighet att arbeta 100% på distans
 


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Biometria ek. för.**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Tina Rabnell eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på sun01@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15107219

title: Oracle EPM developer till storbank
description:
Är du passionerad över teknik och vill göra en verklig skillnad i finansvärlden? Ta chansen att bli en del av ett högpresterande team på en av Sveriges ledande storbanker.
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, möjlighet till distansarbete 1-2 dagar i veckan
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Omgående
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 I rollen som Oracle EPM utvecklare kommer du fokusera på att underhålla och utveckla finansiella lösningar för storbankens kunder. För att lyckas i rollen har du en god analytisk förmåga och goda tekniska kunskaper tillsammans med en god förståelse för affärs- och finansiella processer.
 


  


 Du kommer att ingå i ett agilt högpresterande team bestående av fyra personer med olika inriktningar inom teknik och ekonomi. Rollen är initialt ett konsultuppdrag via Academic Work, med möjlighet till överrekrytering.
 


  


  

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:**



  

  
* Skapa skräddarsydda Oracle-lösningar: Designa och implementera Oracle-verktyg som överensstämmer med bästa praxis och företagets affärsbehov.
  
* Optimera prestanda: Övervaka och finjustera systemen för att säkerställa högsta effektivitet.
  
* Lösa problem: Vara i framkant när det gäller att lösa problem och säkerställa smidig och effektiv drift.
  
* Samarbeta: Arbeta nära med ett mångsidigt team, dela insikter och driva kontinuerlig förbättring.
  


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Utbildningsmöjligheter: Tillgång till utbildningsprogram och kontinuerliga läranderesurser.
  
* Stöttande team: Under din introduktion kommer du arbeta dedikerat med en kollega som stöttar dig i din utveckling.
  
* Inkluderande kultur: En vänlig och välkomnande miljö där alla kan trivas.
  
* Innovationshub: Bli en del av ett innovativt företag i framkant av tekniken.
  
* Moderna arbetsmetoder: Omfamna agila och moderna arbetsmetoder.
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Relevant examen: Exempelvis inom IT/datavetenskap eller ekonomisk bakgrund.
  
* Språk: Flytande i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
  
* Tidigare erfarenhet: Dokumenterad teknisk kompetens från tidigare yrken eller projekt.
  
* EPM-expertis: Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att konfigurera och utveckla EPM-lösningar.
  
* Grundläggande förståelse: Programmering och affärssystem.
  
* Mycket goda kunskaper i engelska i tal och skrift
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har:**



  

  
* Erfarenhet av FCCS (Financial Consolidation Close)
  
* Erfarenhet av group accounting
  
* Goda kunskaper i Svenska i tal och skrift
  


  


  

**Personliga egenskaper för att lyckas i rollen:**



  

  
* Analytisk förmåga
  
* Proaktiv problemlösare
  
* Initiativtagande
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Filippa Danell Karlberg eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på sth2@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15107325

title: Konsultuppdrag | Scrum Master
description:
11/01/2024
   

 Est. End Date:09/30/2025
   

 Target Rate 930 sek/H
   

  

 - Office policy; At least 2days per week working at the Solna office, sometimes maybe more.
   

  

 What You'll Do:
   

 As a Scrum Master, you will support three of our DevOps teams within the Analytics area, ensuring they can deliver technical solutions that meet business needs and customer expectations. You will be at the forefront of fostering growth, enabling agile practices, and solving complex problems.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

 • Facilitate and guide three agile development teams, working closely with Product Owners, Solution Designers, and Data Engineers.
   

 • Collaborate with the Product Owner to understand development needs and team competencies, ensuring the right size and skillset are in place.
   

 • Coach, mentor, and inspire the team, helping them grow as engineers and stay motivated to tackle complex technical problems.
   

 • Advocate for and implement modern agile software development practices, ensuring the delivery of robust and sustainable solutions.
   

 • Support the Developer Experience by removing impediments, enabling the team to self-organize, and fostering continuous improvement.
   

 • Lead Scrum ceremonies, including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, sprint demos, and retrospectives, ensuring smooth and efficient team workflows.
   

 • Prevent scope creep in sprints, track scope changes, and ensure proper alignment with IT Managers before development starts.
   

 • Execute regular Team Health Checks, promote collaboration across teams, and maintain open communication with stakeholders.
   

 • Track team value creation and monitor sprint burn rates, working closely with the Product Owner to deliver maximum value each sprint.
   

 Additional Responsibilities:
   

 • Scrum Ways of Working (WoW): Ensure adherence to Scrum values and practices.
   

 • Sprint Planning: Adapt plans to team size, ensuring room for unplanned activities.
   

 • Product Owner Support: Assist with backlog refinement, backlog planning, and resource requests.
   

 • DevSecOps Collaboration: Foster a strong relationship between the Product Owner and the DevSecOps team to enable seamless collaboration.
   

 • Operational Collaboration: Work with System Manager for operational tasks and alignment.
   

 Skills:Key skills:
   

 • Several years working as a Scrum Master (5+)
   

 • Proven experience as a Scrum Master, particularly in supporting IT and DevOps teams.
   

 • A passion for agile methodologies and the ability to lead, coach, and inspire a team to perform at their best.
   

 • Strong collaboration skills, with experience working with cross-functional teams, including Product Owners, engineers, and business stakeholders.
   

 • Ability to handle multiple projects and teams, ensuring alignment with business goals and delivering on time.
   

 • Swedish speaking
   

 • Fluent in English
   

  

 Meritorious:
   

 • Experience in similar work
   

 • Background as a project manager
   

 • Running large complex project with many stakeholders.
   

 • Experience in analytics and data-driven solutions is a plus!
   

  

 Personal/consultant profile:
   

 • You are someone that loves to grow and improve an effective self-organizing, cross-functional team where individuals recognize that team success is key
   

 • As a Scrum Master you are passionate about developing individuals, facilitating good teamwork and building fantastic products
   

 • You are someone that understands how to translate product and business goals into technical solutions
   

 • Knowledgeable about modern software development
 




  





**Om oss** 




**Senterprise Consulting är ett eget affärsområde inom Senterprise Sverige och är en ledande oberoende förmedlare av frilansande konsulter.
   

 Genom aktiv headhunting och search och en omfattande teknisk förståelse hjälper Senterprise Sverige de främsta arbetsgivarna att hitta de mest lämpade kandidaterna för både anställning och konsultbehov.**
*Läs vidare på* 
*www.senterprise.se*

title: MS Dynamics 365 Developer to Advisory | SEB, Solna
description:
Are you excited about creating innovative, future-proof digital solutions? Join our dynamic team and help design and enhance the digital Meeting experience for our private and corporate customers.
   

  

 We’re looking for a skilled Microsoft Dynamics 365 Developer to join our agile team in advancing our MS Dynamics 365 solutions and integrated Meeting Booking functionalities.
   

  

**About the role:**
 In this role you will contribute to the development of meeting booking functionalities using the MS Dynamics 365 platform, used across our retail business. This will involve solving complex problems, enhance existing systems and develop new features to meet business needs.
   

  

 Here you get the chance to grow your skills in a supportive environment where learning and innovation are key. You will collaborate with a global cross-functional team to deliver high-impact solutions in a fast-paced environment. The team consists of developers, QA, Scrum Master and Product owner, spread across Sweden and Malaysia.
   

  

**To thrive in this role, we believe you have:**
* MS Dynamics 365 CE experience (On-prem and/or online)
* Strong skills in .NET
* Experience with Azure DevOps and lifecycle management
* Familiarity with API design and development for system integrations
* A proactive attitude with a sense of ownership and responsibility
* Excellent communication skills in English, and a positive, collaborative team spirit
* A problem-solving mindset with a strong technical expertise
* It is meritorious if you have experience from Angular web development
* Docker or OpenShift experience in a containerized development is also meritorious


**What we offer:**
* Agile and modern ways of working
* A flat hierarchy and openness to share ideas, opinions and points of views
* Extensive training and learning opportunities


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 30th of October 2024. If you have questions about the position, please contact Team Manager Anna Lindfelt via email at anna.lindfelt@seb.se
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEBhere** 
 : www.sebgroup.com/techcareers
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Associate Technical Director
company_industry: Computer Games, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Software Development
description:
**We are EA**
 For more than fifteen years we've entertained millions of players around the world with our award-winning games. Our teams have expressed their passion for outstanding game feel, audio-visual quality and technical innovation in the Need for Speed, Battlefield and Star Wars Battlefront franchises.
   

  

**The Challenge Ahead**
 We are DRE (Development & Release Engineering) - a central EA team at the intersection of DevOps, Release Management and Build Engineering. We build, manage and maintain the build pipelines for the majority of EA’s studios worldwide. We are looking for an Associate Technical director for our DRE Cobra team that is based in Europe who can be both hands-on and a people manager for approximately 5 engineers
   

  

 In your role as an Associate Technical Director, you will help us grow and develop a strong team, setting and driving the execution of technical roadmap with direction from the leadership team You are a experienced software developer with experience in modern software development practices, and have experience working with game build pipelines before. Ideally, you are familiar with diverse DevOps practices such as continuous integration, infrastructure as a code and cloud technologies.
   

  

 Reporting to a Technical Director, this means building thoughtful engineering teams, partnering with the teams and responsibilities that your teams will support our customers (the game teams) to ensure we can provide services that build the game software and find the fun faster.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Experience leading agile engineering teams while still being hands on
* People management experience (either formal or informal)
* Strong coding skills.
* Worked on a game team, ideally as a tools or build engineer
* Familiarity with CI Systems such as Jenkins, Azure DevOps or similar
* Familiarity with container/VM technologies (Docker, vSphere, and Kubernetes)
* Analytical and methodical problem solving skills


**Would be a bonus**
* Monitoring tools like Grafana, Kibana, DataDog
* Experience with As-Code management tools (e.g. Terraform, Ansible, Packer)
* Familiarity with Document Databases (e.g. Elasticsearch, MongoDB)
* Experience with Package repositories (e.g. Artifactory).

title: Azure Cloud Solutions Architect
description:
**About Redeploy Build**
 At Redeploy Build, we are cloud specialists. What we do is build and integrate best-in-breed cloud environments, steering clear of legacy constraints and “old-IT”.
   

  

 We help our clients within all areas of public cloud - from building, governing, migrating and optimizing our client’s cloud resources. Living by a “Cloud always, in all ways” motto, we always get things done and are not just another powerpoint-firm, rather getting our hands dirty and putting tech into practice. Learn more about us here.
   

  

 As a rapidly growing public cloud company, we understand that our success depends on the talents we choose to surround ourselves with. Now we are looking for a Azure Cloud Solutions Architect in Stockholm, Göteborg or Jönköping who wants to be a part of our continued success story. Maybe it's you?
   

  

**What it means to be a Azure Cloud Solutions Architect at Redeploy Build**
 As a Azure Cloud Solution Architect, you will be a crucial member of the team and hold a multifaceted role, assuming the responsibility of owning client relationships right from the project's inception to the finish line.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 From the initial dialogues with clients to project kick-off, this role demands a seasoned professional who can seamlessly transition from talking to product owners/management and take ownership of the design, architecture, and driving the technical delivery alongside the client and our skilled team. Your responsibilities will include following areas:
   

  

* Client Relationship Ownership: Establish and nurture relationships with clients, initiating crucial dialogues at the project's outset to gain a comprehensive understanding of their objectives and expectations.
* Design and Architecture Ownership: Take charge of the conceptualization and design phase, translating client requirements into robust and innovative Azure solutions.
* Technical Delivery Leadership: Drive the technical delivery process, collaborating closely with the team to ensure the seamless implementation of cloud solutions. Your expertise will be instrumental in achieving project milestones and exceeding client expectations. We also expect you to be hands on and code, deploy and document when needed.


**Who are you?**
 We believe that you have a passion for cloud architecture and that you enjoy creating value and solving problems for clients and businesses. You’re a natural leader and open-minded, positive, driven and a curious person who understands the power of team collaboration and sharing knowledge with others.
 **What experiences do you bring?**
* Experience in leading complex large-scale projects, particularly with enterprise customers or large organizations.
* A solid understanding of business operations and dynamics, allowing you to align technical solutions with overarching business objectives.
* Advanced knowledge and hands-on experience with Azure is essential, with additional public clouds such as AWS and GCP considered advantageous.
* A strong background in development, engineering or technical roles including hands-on experience with conceptualizing, strategizing, designing and architecting cloud solutions.
* Knowledge and practical experience of programming and Dev(Sec)Ops and Platform Engineering.
* Hands-on experience with IaC (Infrastructure-as-Code) with bicep and/or terraform for example.
* Fluency in Swedish and English.


**And if you come with following experiences, you will stick out from the crowd!**
* Container management and microservices such as Kubernetes, Docker and Openshift.
* Data and Analytics such as Databricks, Snowflake, Azure Fabric and Power BI.
* Developer Experience, Cloud Optimization, Machine Learning and FinOps framework.


*Even if you don’t perfectly match the role, we still encourage you to apply. We believe in diversity and inclusion and welcome all applicants with relevant experience and skills.*
 🤝
 **What we offer**
 Being a member of Redeploy means you have the drive and desire to be the best and work smarter than the rest. We enjoy creative freedom with our projects, benefit from great work/life balance, and thrive in a company culture that is both collaborative and supportive. Everything we do at Redeploy is centered around the simple yet effective idea that we all chip in to ensure our success.
   

  

**To Learn More About Our Benefits, Scroll Down 👇🏼**
 📍
 **Location**
 We have offices located in central Stockholm, Göteborg and Jönköping. As we encourage a mix of in-person and remote work to foster innovation and support work-life balance (and like to have fun together), we see that you are based in commuting distance to our any office locations.
   

  

 📩
 **How to apply**
 We hope that we have sparked your interest and that you are curious to know more about the role and us at Redeploy.
   

  

 We are constantly recruiting, so submit your application as soon as you can by hitting the apply button. To be compliant with GDPR, we only accept applications through our careers channel. Please submit your application using the form on our career website, or any website displaying a position with us.
   

  

 For any specific questions about the position, reach out to Talent Acquisition Manager Francisca Andersson.
   

  

 We look forward hearing from you!

title: ServiceNow solution consultant - Stockholm
description:
Would you like to join the leading business technology company in the Nordics? Do you speak both business and technology fluently? If yes, keep reading!
   

  

 Sofigate is growing fast and we’re looking for an experienced
 **ServiceNow solution consultant** 
 to join our Platforms business stream. We’re looking for someone with a growth mindset and passion for how technology and business are changing the world.
   

  

 Within the Platforms business stream we collaborate with our customers in finding the next innovative solution that will support the customer to achieve better business results. Time to value is what matters for our customers and for us! Modern ways of working, leveraging lates techniques focusing on customer needs is part of our DNA when we make sure our customers get the most out of their investments.
   

  

**Who are we looking for?**
 We're seeking a dynamic ServiceNow expert who excels in deciphering client business goals and effortlessly translates them into precise technical requirements. Your expertise spans Agile frameworks, DevOps models, and a proven track record with POC approaches. Beyond that, you bring valuable experience seamlessly navigating both traditional waterfall methods and cutting-edge methodologies.
   

  

 Your skills align perfectly with our core values, Dare, Care and Grow: daring to innovate, caring for impactful solutions, and a commitment to continual growth. Join us in shaping the future of ServiceNow development with a team that values your unique blend of technical prowess and a forward-thinking mindset.
   

  

 What we expect:
   

  

* You have a few years of experience of ServiceNow and potentially other cloud based solutions
* You have both good communication and technical skills, with facilitating abilities.
* You are passionate about technology, and what innovative solutions can do for organizations. You are fluent in both Swedish and English.
* Expertise with HR tech and / or background in HR is considered a plus


**What’s in it for you?**
 As a Sofigator, you get the opportunity to work with knowledgeable and driven colleagues, develop and challenge yourself and create sustainable value for our customers. We have an international, vibrant and fun culture with great openness and flexibility. We value every Sofigator and strive to build a diverse, equal, and inclusive workplace where everyone’s voice is heard, and where everyone can become the best versions of themselves. We value a healthy work life balance and support you in maintaining it.
   

  

 Growth is not just a corporate thing for us – it is personal. There is so much to explore and learn within our community, and together with our customers, that having a bit of fun is unavoidable.
   

  

 We do not leave the future up to chance. We take ownership of it. You can, too. Own your future!
   

  

**We would like to hear from you**
 If you want to join our journey to dare, care and grow together with our clients and fellow Sofigators, we are eager to hear more from you. Please, tell us more about your background, competences and your motivation to be part of our growth story.
   

  

 If you have any questions please contact Robert Lingemark, Business Lead Platforms robert.lingemark@sofigate.com
   

  

**About Sofigate**
*We are The Business Technology Company with the fastest time-to-value in the gen AI era. We achieve that by combining our transformation expertise with low/no-code platforms and generative AI. That’s how we create sustainable customer value. In practice, that means helping our customers to develop the interplay between business and technology: to design, build and implement transformations and business-friendly technology solutions, like Salesforce, ServiceNow and SAP.*
*As leaders of Business Technology management, we are the founder of the Business Technology Forum, the developer of the Business Technology Standard. Our team of 800+ professionals based in 8 offices across 5 countries – Finland, Sweden, Denmark, Hungary and Poland – are always ready to help, both our colleagues and our customers. At the very core of our being are our values: dare, care and grow. We dare to challenge the market, foster a community that cares about our people and drive growth with a customer centric business vision.*

title: Head of Impact & Startup Founder (March 2025)
job_function: Information Technology, Business Development, and Strategy/Planning
company_industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:
**This ad is not for an employment, but an opportunity to build a VC-backed startup from the ground up.** 




  





**Who you are:** 




 You are a highly accomplished professional with a demonstrated track record in advancing sustainability initiatives. Your expertise lies within critical areas like renewable energy, food security, or the blue economy. Driven by a passion for positive change, you envision building a groundbreaking tech startup that disrupts the status quo and propels sustainability solutions forward.
 



  





**About Antler** 




 Antler is the world's most active venture capital firm, providing funding from pre-seed to Series C. We invest in Founders who seek to define our tomorrow and reshape the world we live in with groundbreaking technological innovation. Every year, we handpick the strongest Founders from more than 135,000 applicants across our 27 locations on the globe, which has led us to work with more than 7,000 founders to date and a portfolio of more than 1,000 startups.
 



  





**The Antler Founder Residency** 




 Join a dynamic cohort of 200+ highly motivated entrepreneurs for an immersive 12-week program. Visit our website for a detailed breakdown of how we'll support your startup launch.
 


* 12-Week full-time Immersive Journey: Kicking off March, 2025, in Stockholm.
* Co-Founder Discovery: In the first 10 weeks, collaborate with fellow Founders to find your co-founder(s).
* Pitch to Invest: Present your team and business idea to the Antler Investment Committee. Secure a net cash investment of EUR 100k for 10% equity.
* Accelerate Growth: If funded, we work closely with you to make your startup a success!



  





**Program Details** 



* **Start Date:** 
 March 3rd, 2025
* **Location:** 
 Onsite at our Stockholm office
* **Compensation:** 
 While participants don't receive financial compensation during the program, pre-seed investment is available to jumpstart your venture.
* **Visa Sponsorship:** 
 Due to the non-employment nature of the program, visa sponsorship is unavailable.



  





**Ideal Candidate Profile** 



* **Domain Expertise:** 
 Possess in-depth knowledge of sustainability sectors like renewable energy, waste management, or the blue economy. You're passionate about building scalable solutions for a greener future.
* **Problem-solving Prowess:** 
 Derive satisfaction from developing innovative products that address real-world challenges.
* **Impact Driven:** 
 Fuel a burning desire to make a positive difference for both people and the planet.
* **Optional:** 
 Arrive equipped with a nascent business idea focused on a specific problem, solution, or technology.



  





**Application Process** 




 Our streamlined application process takes only 2-3 weeks:
 


1. Apply through our website.
2. Participate in an introductory interview.
3. Progress to an in-depth interview with our partners.
4. Receive a potential offer.



  





**Meet Our Nordic Success Stories:** 



* **Wingbits:** 
 Community-driven flight data; redefining air travel efficiency.
* **Two:** 
 A comprehensive B2B payment suite simplifying sales for online and offline businesses.
* **Evyon:** 
 A developer of eco-friendly battery energy storage systems.
* **Glint Solar:** 
 Software accelerating identification of optimal solar installation sites.
* **PerPlant:** 
 AI-powered sensor systems creating a gateway to sustainable agriculture

title: Backend-utvecklare till Crediflow!
description:
Är du en erfaren backend-utvecklare med gedigen kunskap inom C#? Söker du en möjlighet att ta nästa steg i din karriär hos ett familjärt bolag som ligger i framkant inom sitt område? Trivs du i en prestigelös arbetsmiljö och vill vara med och forma framtidens molntjänster? Då vill vi höra från dig!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Crediflow AB
 



  

**Plats :**
 Täby
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Crediflow är en ledande aktör som levererar lösningar inom e-faktura och EDI till företag och myndigheter. Du erbjuds en spännande tjänst på ett företag som ligger i framkant inom sitt område. Idag hanterar Crediflow en stor del av alla fakturor som skickas och tas emot i Norden och andra länder.
   

 Sedan start har ambitionen varit att förenkla och effektivisera företagsprocesser, genom att förenkla utbytet av elektroniska dokument. Oavsett vem kunden vill skicka till eller ta emot ifrån erbjuder Crediflow ett enkelt och effektivt sätt att hantera företagens dokumentflöden på – hela vägen från order till betalning. Crediflows anpassningsbara och skalbara lösningar innefattar bästa praxis inom logistik, ekonomi och IT.
 


  


 I rollen som Backend-utvecklare är du en del av ett team med utvecklare i Helsingborg och Stockholm. Du blir en nyckelspelare i utvecklingen av Crediflows ledande molntjänst. Tjänsten innebär också att lyssna in och förstå verksamhetens behov och komma med förslag på lösningar och ändringar, för att sedan vara med och skapa dessa. Har du dessutom ett intresse och teknisk förståelse kring AI finns stora möjligheter att påverka företagets utveckling och användning inom detta framåt.
   




**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Utveckling i C# i cloudbaserad miljö
  
* Skapa och förbättra ramverk i koden
  
* Vara delaktig i beslut rörande drift och utveckling av Crediflows cloudbaserade system
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har
   

**gedigen erfarenhet av utveckling i C#, gärna inom produktutveckling**
  
* Har en stark förståelse för development patterns och strukturdesign
  
* Är van vid att arbeta och optimera molnbaserade tjänster för att skapa effektiva och pålitliga system
  
* Talar flytande svenska
  


  


  

**Det är även meriterande om du har:**



  

  
* Erfarenhet av Python (helst inom AI) och frontendutveckling (t.ex angular)
  
* Erfarenhet inom design och optimering av databaser och SQL
  
* Erfarenhet från verksamhet med intensiva transaktionsflöden
  
* Erfarenhet av Agila arbetssätt
  


  


 I rollen som backend utvecklare kommer du själv få testa din kod, vilket sätter krav på en noggrannhet och en självkritisk förmåga. Som person ser vi att du är självgående och tycker om att se lösningar på problem.
 


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
