title: Service Engineer
description:
BROMMA has been the leading manufacturer of crane spreaders ever since its formation in the 1960s. Today we have, by far, the highest market share of the world’s spreader suppliers. In fact, our market share is higher than all our competitors’ combined. Today, we manufacture close to 2,000 spreaders of all types every year and our spreaders are currently in use in 99 of the top-100 ports world- wide.
   

  

 BROMMA sales and service network has a wide-reaching footprint. We are present with own sales offices on all continents, and with an extensive network of agents, we are able to support customers in every country in the world.
   

  

 More information about BROMMA can be found on www.bromma.com
   

  

****We're making every move count****
 Do you want to be part of a highly skilled, positive, and ambitious team within our After Sales support? Have you previously worked as a field service technician? There will be a great opportunity to develop your personal skills and to grow as a person when working within Sales regions in EMEA.
   

  

 We are now searching for a new team member to join our team of friendly professionals in Bromma, Kalmar Mobile Solutions as a
 **Service Engineer** 
 . You will have the opportunity to perform services related work within the EMEA region, including dealing with commissioning, warranty and RUPs.
   

  

 This position is located in Kista, Sweden- frequent travelling in the EMEA region will be included and you will report Service Manager; BRM Sales & After Sales EMEA After Sales Services.
   

  

****Main tasks and responsibilities****
 As a Service Engineer you will support with after sales support and deliver first level technical support for our customers. You will provide excellent customer support to our customers with claims and quality concerns. As a Service Engineer you will also provide RUP technical and sales support and remote EMEA support. You will also conduct product knowledge training for our customers.
   

  

****What you’ll need to succeed****
 Education
   

  

* Electronic/PLC/Programming, high school or other relevant education.


**Experience**
* Hands on experience in heavy machinery
* At least 2 years of relevant business / product experience
* Mechanical, hydraulic and control system basic knowledge
* Specific market knowledge or experience is a merit.


 Competencies
   

  

* Excellent computer literacy
* A strong technical background.


 As a person you are innovative. You like to learn new things and like to present technical solutions to customers. You are a team player but also able to find your own paths, both at work and when out travelling. You are used to collaborate with different kind of people, and you can keep your customer service mindset also in challenging situations. Very good skills in English, verbally and in writing are essential, other languages such as French are a merit.
   

  

****You will be part of****
 We believe in our people as it is our people who really make the difference. We always work in close collaboration with our customers, deliver on our promises and never walk away no matter how big the challenge. We succeed because we do it together.
   

  

 With us, you will have the opportunity to realise your potential and become an important member of our global team.
   

  

****Interested to join?****
 If you are excited about this opportunity, please submit your application now!
   

  

 We accept applications in both Swedish and English.
   

  

 Please note that the interview process may begin before the closing date of the job posting.
   

  

 Bromma is part of Kalmar (Nasdaq Helsinki:KALMAR). Kalmar offers a wide range of industry shaping heavy material handling equipment and services to ports and terminals, distribution centres, manufacturing and heavy logistics. Headquartered in Helsinki, Finland, Kalmar operates globally in over 120 countries and employs approximately 5,200 people. In 2023, the company's sales on a carve-out basis totalled approximately EUR 2.0 billion.
   

  

 www.kalmarglobal.com

title: Microstrategy Developer
description:
MicroStrategy Developer - Long Term Project - Contract - Stockholm
 



  





 We are seeking an experienced MicroStrategy developer to build and deliver reporting solutions for end users. Key responsibilities include analyzing business requirements, designing semantic layers, creating reports/dashboards, ensuring data security, and supporting end users for one of our leading banking customers in Stockholm.
 



  





**Required Skills:** 



* Expertise in MicroStrategy with large datasets
* Proficient in SQL and Python
* Knowledge of SAF framework (preferred)
* Strong teamwork skills



  





 This role involves end-to-end solution development, from design to production release and ongoing user support.
 



  





 Must be able to travel in to the office in Stockholm occasional and this is also a long-term project with extensions to follow.
 



  





 Apply Now!
